intro: Hartia nankwanica, commonly known as the Nankwana lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and has strap-like leaves that are evergreen. It produces showy inflorescences that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
